item.title: No needed anymore :)
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ITI Basak ITI, post:3, topic:394225”]… This is simple… but I understand… We were all at this point at one time or another zyle 

	case (object Id):
		c.getPA().openUpBank();
	break;

Add that code into your action handler

Your welcome… But, in the future, go to the search bar in your source file, and type what your looking for. If you type Bank, it will come up with all the files that have the work bank. You would come across a similar code in your actionHandler. The greatest teacher of all is the source it self. You can learn a lot by just looking at the already made codes and base yours off them.

Good Luck[/quote]

Sadly, we live in a society where everyone expects to be spoonfed. And if you don’t spoonfeed everyone, you’re called an asshole, jerk, etc. “Thinking” in today’s society is sadly “optional”. And in this community, the majority of people don’t want to think. They want to be told what to do, and if it doesn’t work, it becomes your fault. I am trying to get people to think, because programming is essentially just a group of logical steps, executed in a logical fashion. If people aren’t willing to think in a logical fashion, they won’t make it as a programmer.

Read full topic

item.title: No needed anymore :)
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

… This is simple… but I understand… We were all at this point at one time or another zyle 

	case (object Id):
		c.getPA().openUpBank();
	break;

Add that code into your action handler

Your welcome… But, in the future, go to the search bar in your source file, and type what your looking for. If you type Bank, it will come up with all the files that have the work bank. You would come across a similar code in your actionHandler. The greatest teacher of all is the source it self. You can learn a lot by just looking at the already made codes and base yours off them.

Good Luck
